title: Commending Orange County Trust Company upon the occasion of receiving the 2010 Business of the Year Award
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  commending Orange County Trust Company upon the
occasion of receiving the 2010 Business of the Year Award by the Town of
Montgomery Chamber of Commerce

WHEREAS, Businesses which provide outstanding services to  residents  of
the  communities of the State of New York are deserving of public recog-
nition and applause for their efforts; and
  WHEREAS, Attendant to such concern, and in full accord with its  long-
standing  traditions,  this  Legislative Body is justly proud to commend
Orange County Trust Company upon the  occasion  of  receiving  the  2010
Business  of  the  Year  Award  by  the  Town  of  Montgomery Chamber of
Commerce; and
  WHEREAS, Orange County Trust Company was honored on April 21, 2010, at
the Colden Manor at Spruce Lodge in Montgomery, New York; and
  WHEREAS, This bank opened its doors for business  in  Middletown,  New
York  on May 2, 1892, under the name of the Orange County Trust and Safe
Deposit Company; its founders  were  14  public  spirited  citizens  who
recognized a need in the prospering industrial town for a banking insti-
tution  which  would  specialize  in  estate planning and trust adminis-
tration, as well as offer traditional banking services; and
  WHEREAS, The original bank building  was  built  on  North  Street  in
Middletown  during  the  year  1891;  the  original name is still on the
building above the top windows, and  on  the  right  side  of  the  main
entrance  is  a  bronze plate with the current name, Orange County Trust
Company, which was changed in 1905; and
  WHEREAS, As the community continued to grow, it became  apparent  that
the  bank  would  need additional space from which to expand and improve
the services needed and demanded by its customers; in 1955, a branch was
constructed in the Silver Lake area on Route  211  and  was  opened  for
business  in  August  of 1955; then in 1969, the Wilson Field Office, on
the site of the current Dolson Avenue office, was opened; and
  WHEREAS, In August of 1995, Orange County  Trust  Company  opened  its
first  branch  outside of the Middletown area; this branch was opened in
the Town of Montgomery on Route 208; construction began in the Spring of
1995 and on August 28th the doors opened for  business;  the  continuous
growth of the Bank and the desire to better serve the people of the area
led  to  the  expansion  beyond Middletown, and Montgomery was a natural
location for the Trust Company, as it is a growing area in close proxim-
ity to the business crossroad of Orange County; and
  WHEREAS, In April of 1997, the Trust Way branch in Middletown, at  the
corner  of  Dunning  Road,  opened;  this  branch replaced the Route 211
branch, and with such a high volume  of  business  at  the  Silver  Lake
branch and limited opportunity for expansion, a new facility was created
to accommodate the needs of the rapidly growing customer base; and
  WHEREAS,  The  Executive  Offices and Loan Department of Orange County
Trust Company were moved from the original main office on  North  Street
to  the  212  Dolson  Avenue  Office  in June of 1999; the Dolson Avenue
Office is now the headquarters of Orange County Trust Company; and
  WHEREAS, Over the last decade, the  Trust  Company  has  continued  to
enjoy  great success and has opened several additional branches through-
out Orange County; and
  WHEREAS, The Morrison family, perennial benefactors  of  the  city  of
Middletown  since  the  turn  of  the  century, has been affiliated with
Orange County Trust Company for all but the first 17 years of the Bank's
existence; John Morrison III currently serves as Chairman of  the  Board
as  did  his  uncle, Eugene Morrison, and his father, John Morrison Jr.,
before him; William D. Morrison is presently a Director of the Bank; and

  WHEREAS, From an institution that began as a  dream  of  14  founders,
Orange  County Trust Company, through conservative business practice and
commitment to its community for 118 years, has grown to  an  independent
and very successful community bank; and
  WHEREAS,  It  is  the  sense of this Legislative Body that when insti-
tutions of such noble aims and accomplishments are brought to our atten-
tion, they should be celebrated and recognized by all  the  citizens  of
the great State of New York; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED,  That  this  Legislative  Body pause in its deliberations to
commend Orange County Trust Company upon the occasion of  receiving  the
2010  Business  of  the  Year Award by the Town of Montgomery Chamber of
Commerce; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That copies of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to John Morrison III, Chairman of the Board, William  D.  Morri-
son, Director, and Terry R.  Saturno, President and CEO.
